alert.note: Alert for Bell; Harlan; Knox; Laurel; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 8:53PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Harlan, southeastern Laurel, Bell, Knox, western Leslie, southeastern Whitley and southern Clay Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 853 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Lida to Wilkerson. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Barbourville, Pineville, Manchester, Middlesboro, Wallins Creek, Sandy Fork, Brightshade, Varilla, Swan Lake, Coldiron, Ponza, Goose Rock, Black Snake, Gausdale, Erose, Bush, Cranes Nest, Blanche, Cubage and Herron. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Hal Rogers Parkway between mile markers 14 and 46. U.S. Highway 25 East in Bell County between mile markers 1 and 18. U.S. Highway 25 East in Knox County between mile markers 1 and 23. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for south central and southeastern Kentucky.
